Sentencas: A simple method to predict the thermal characteristics of a micro-SOFC system is presented in this study.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: The basic design requirements for a thermally self-sustaining operation at a stack temperature of about 550 degrees C are assessed.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: Based on steady-state global energy and mass balances, the influence of the electrical efficiency, the overall air-to-fuel ratio and the heat losses on the operating temperature is discussed.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: It was found that at high electrical efficiencies and, hence, low heat release rates, a recuperator is needed to achieve the desired operating temperature.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: At lower electrical efficiencies, in contrast, disposing the released heat becomes an issue and an efficient cooling of the stack is required.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: Whether a recuperator or additional cooling components are necessary also depends on the electrical power output, the stack size and the thermal insulation specifications.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: The threshold between cooling and recuperator mode is of special interest, since this operating point allows a simple design of the thermal system without recuperator and only a minimum of air to be supplied to the system.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: This threshold efficiency, which is the maximal electrical efficiency that allows a thermally self-sustaining operation without recuperator, is above 50% under adiabatic operating conditions.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: In a non-adiabatic system, the threshold efficiency is reduced to about 45% in a 20 W-el and to about 20% in a 2.5 W-el system even with a state-of-the art thermal insulation.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: The considered thermal insulations dominate the system volume.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances

Sentencas: Therefore, the ability of heat loss minimization is highly dependent on the targeted volumetric power density of the system.
Titulo: Analyzing a micro-solid oxide fuel cell system by global energy balances
